revised_title: North Atlantic's Role in the Global Carbon Cycle: Sedimentary Processes and Stratigraphic Record
tldr: This article explores the role of the North Atlantic in the global carbon cycle, focusing on sedimentary processes and the creation of the stratigraphic record in the Late Quaternary North Atlantic Ocean. It discusses the effects of vertical flux, lateral flux, and resuspension on sedimentation, as well as the challenges in interpreting the stratigraphic record due to various sedimentary processes and environmental changes.
